data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

You always face forward. When you take 9 steps left you are now facing forward. When you take 9 steps right you are now facing backward. If you follow the instructions, you always return home. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you are turning left and take 4 steps, you’ll be back at the starting point. It is not possible to turn right as stated in the instructions. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Taking 6 steps returns to the beginning point. If you take 4 steps, they return you to the beginning point. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The starting point is the point 7 steps from home. For the 7th step, you take this number of steps: 71 steps. For the 7th step, you take this number of steps: 76 steps. For the 9th step, you take this number of steps: 96 steps. Therefore, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To return to the starting point, you take a full journey and return to the starting point using the same strategy you used for the first direction change. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Turn left turns around and turns around turns around turns around turn around turns around takes 7 steps. This is impossible to do in 7 steps so 7 steps for the next set of steps. Turn around again and turn around takes 7 steps. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you take 9 steps and back turn right and take 8 steps. If you take 9 steps and turn right, take 8 steps. If you turn right and back turn right and take 8 steps. No. Thus, the answer is Yes.

On the first step you should take 6 steps. On the second step you should take 8 steps. On the third step you should take 2 steps. All three steps can be done in one sequence. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You cannot take 6 steps back when you are facing forward. Thus, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
There are 3 steps in Take 3 steps. There are 7 steps in Take 7 steps. The answer: No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The following steps require three steps to reverse them: Take 1 step backward Take 1 step backward Take 3 steps forward. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Before taking one step backward, the order in which you step should always be facing forward. This way, one is less likely to fall in front of a moving object. If facing correctly, one does not need to do anything else. The first one backward is always in the opposite direction from the direction of the original step. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

In the first set of instructions you never face left. In the second set of instructions you always face left. After each set, you always take the same number of steps from point A to point B. Thus, you always take 4 steps right when you come to the ending point. Therefore, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If one always faces forward and walks always straight, we will see our starting point. If one always faces behind, we will think we are going forward and would miss our beginning point. As with the instructions, when one steps onward, one takes 3 steps from where they started. As with the instructions, the right-handed person would return to their right-most step. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

You always face forward so you always have to face forward when you are pointing to a vertical object. The first thing the person does is take 3 steps right and the next thing they do is take 3 steps right and the next thing they do is face the same direction as you are moving. The next step is still facing forward while the last step is facing left. You always take 6 steps left but the last thing you do is take 3 steps right at the same time you are taking 3 steps right. So, the answer is No.

Turn right to the third street on the left. Left turn to the third street on the far left. Left turn to the fourth street on the far left. So, the answer is Yes.

If you take 3 steps then you take 6 steps after turn around. If you take 10 steps then you turn around and take 10 steps. So, the answer is yes.

The first instructions have you return to the starting point. If you take 7 steps in one direction, you will get to the beginning point of the turn. The second instructions have you return to the starting point of the turn. The third instruction has you return to what is the starting point. Taking 9 steps means that you get to the ending point of the turn. So, the answer is no.

You can not turn back when you are already going in some direction. If you are going in the direction you were traveling there are already multiple ways to turn. So, the answer is No.

Turn right and take 1 step after stepping to the right. Take 5 steps after you took 1 step. So, the answer is Yes.

You repeat steps 2 and 4 to go back to the beginning. So, the answer is No.

Taking 3 steps leads to the first step. Taking 2 steps leads to the first step. Taking 10 steps leads to the finishing step. So, the answer is No.

Turning around requires you to back the direction you started from. Turning around requires you to turn the direction you started from. So, the answer is Yes.

When you follow the directions mentioned in the introduction, you always face forward. The first step is always forward. The backward steps repeats that process. Now you are back in first place. So, the answer is No.

If you always face forward, you always get to the starting point. If you don’t always face forward, we can always face forward. So, the answer is no.

The starting point will always be face forward. It will always be straight. You can’ t just keep facing forward and take up 10 steps right. In order to start a new turn, you must always face forward. When you start a new turn, you always face left and not backward. When you are backward you go right and not left.
